title.narrative: The Young Women for Awareness, Agency, Advocacy, and Accountability (YW4A) Programme- Global

description.narrative: The programme aims to The programme will achieve this through 4 main outcomes: 1. Strengthening the advocacy capacity of 27 women’s rights organizations (WROs) to amplify young women’s voices in Palestine, Egypt, Kenya, and South Sudan by 2025. 2. Enhancing the leadership of 17,540 young women to effectively engage in collective action and decision-making in public, private, and civic spaces in Palestine, Egypt, Kenya, and South Sudan by 2025. 3. Transforming social norms and practices of 22 faith-based organizations (FBOs) that constrain young women’s rights in Palestine, Egypt, Kenya, and South Sudan by 2025. 4. Influence the adoption, amendment, withdrawal or effective utilisation and implementation of 18 laws and policies towards promoting young women’s rights to leadership, participation and ending SGBV in Palestine, Egypt, Kenya and South Sudan by 2025.

The programme aims to strengthen and diversify young women’s participation and amplify their voices to effectively influence decision-making towards gender-just laws, policies, norms, and practices related to their bodily integrity and equal participation.

title.narrative: Social norms and practices by community actors and faith-based organisations shift towards promoting young women's rights to dignity, bodily integrity, and equal participation in decision-making.

description.narrative: For faith organisations to effectively champion women's rights and gender equality among communities, they need to examine their internal policies, practices, teachings and rules first. They also need to assess the extent to which their actions and practices contribute to enhancing gender equality and women’s rights.The faith-based gender assessment methodology seeks to facilitate a transformative organisational change process of embedding gender equality and young women’s rights within faith organisations. It provides a sequential approach to assist faith organisations to reflect on the extent to which they have integrated gender equality into organisations policies, beliefs, vision, mission, decision-making structures, teachings, and practices. The gender assessment process results in a set of priorities, from which faith organisations can develop action plans to embed gender equality within their organisations.

reference.code: WRGE indicator 5.2.1: # of organizations with strengthened capacity to advance women’s rights and gender equality (link SCS5)

title.narrative: Qualitative Indicator: Observed progress in internal processes and institutional change, leadership attitude change, spaces for women, external teachings, changing approaches in favour of gender equality and young women’s rights to bodily integrity and equal participation in decision-making

description.narrative: Through the assessment, it provides a sequential approach to assist faith organisations to reflect on the extent to which they have integrated gender equality into organisations' policies, beliefs, vision, mission, decision-making structures, teachings, and practices. The gender assessment process results in a set of priorities, from which faith organisations can develop action plans to embed gender equality within their organisations. The implementation of the action plans will lead to institutional change.

reference.code: WRGE indicator 5.2.1: # of organizations with strengthened capacity to advance women’s rights and gender equality (link SCS5)

comment.narrative: Qualitative evidence on achievements and barriers that explain the quantitative assessment scores to be measured at mid term

Target 13 FBOS with improved progress in internal processes and institutional change, leadership attitude change, spaces for women, external teachings, changing approaches in favour of gender equality and young women’s rights to bodily integrity and equal participation in decision-making through the implementation of gender action plans.

title.narrative: # of faith-based organisations with improved norms and practices on young women's rights on bodily integrity and equal participation in decision-making.

description.narrative: Baseline (YR 1) where faith organisations self-assess capacity to commit to 1) young women’s rights 2) gender equality in internal organisation/practices 3) young women’s rights and gender equality in teachings.

reference.code: WRGE indicator 5.2.1: # of organizations with strengthened capacity to advance women’s rights and gender equality (link SCS5)

comment.narrative: The FBO gender assessment resulted in rates for nine sub-domains with evidence and justifications, and a calculation of the overall gender capacity score for each FBO. The overall gender capacity score constitutes the baseline value for indicator IO3a
